item.title: Wavelet Transform
item.description: In general, given a complete set of function $\psi(x; \tilde x)$, we can decompose a function $F(\tilde x)$ $$ F(\tilde x) = \int f(x) \psi(x;\tilde x) dx. $$ The choice of $\psi(x;\tilde x)$ gives us different properties. Fourier Transform Fourier transform is good for stationary analysis since time is not involved in $F(\omega)$. $$ F(\omega) = \int_{-\infty}^{\infty} f(t) e^{-i \omega t} dt $$ Short-time Fourier Transform STFT is a Fourier transform with a moving time window $\tau$,
